result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L. White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

No contact with T.H., N.V., & M.V.
Absolute sobriety.

Counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample and surcharge unless already completed.
15 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling or combination of the two.

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample.

Case Called: 11:07am. INCLUDES 14CF212, 14CF747. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Mike Puerner for ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant does not appear. Atty Dana Norgard appears for Defendant. Matter set for Status Conference - SAR's to be held in BR 1 cases.  COURT states that Judicial Assistant contacted Jail officer Shawn Blaska and that that Defendant was personally to appear as she is housed in Taylor County Jail.  Jail now has informed Court that Defendant was not to be brought per BR 2- Defendant has pending files in BR 2 also. Atty Norgard makes statement re: BR 1 & BR 2 files and communication with Defendant. COURT does not object to either BR 1 or BR 2 hearing global resolution.  Statememts by State. DATES: Calendar Call 7/27/15 @ 1pm BR 1. Adjourned: 11:13am.
Status conference on June 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH on each count for 4 years probation - 
Conditions: AODA; absolute sobriety; cunseling as deemed appropriate by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain  FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; no contact w/ T.H., N.V. M.W.; pay court costs and provide DNA sample and pay surcharge unless already completed.
Additional conditions: 14CF747 1 year MCJ imposed and stayed for rule violations; sentences to run concurrent; 4 days credit for case 14CF212 and 15 days credit for case 14CF747 if revoked.
